page.title: 02LODSWORTH
page.content: Just before the{ Halfway Bridge Inn}on the road to{ Petworth} from{ Midhurst, there is a turning to the left which leads to{Lodsworth.}The lane gradually rises uphill through pleasant fields for about half a mile and then enters a space surrounded by beautiful 18th century houses. Another lane on the right leads down to{St.Peter's Church. It is a village rich in ancient cottages. High on a sandstone hill, lush pastures and woods are all around, while in the distance towards the South are the rolling Downs. In{1801}the census recorded the population as{433; in 1851 - 661, {in 1901 - 575, in 1961 - 526,in 1971 - {558;}in 1981 it was {650. {
